thread.title: NHL: Another rookie steals the spotlight from Oilers' No. 1 pick Connor McDavid
thread.title_full: NHL: Another rookie steals the spotlight from Oilers' No. 1 pick Connor McDavid

title: NHL: Another rookie steals the spotlight from Oilers' No. 1 pick Connor McDavid
text: NHL: Another rookie steals the spotlight from Oilers’ No. 1 pick Connor McDavid The Associated Press First Published Oct 08 2015 10:27PM • Last Updated Oct 08 2015 10:59 pm Edmonton Oilers' Connor McDavid warms up before the start of an NHL hockey game against the St. Louis Blues, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) Edmonton Oilers' Connor McDavid warms up before the start of an NHL hockey game against the St. Louis Blues, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) NHL » St. Louis’ Fabbri scores, while Oilers’ star rookie a non-factor in debut. Share This Article ARTICLE PHOTO GALLERY (16) St. Louis • Rookie Robby Fabbri scored the tiebreaking goal midway through the third period to help the St. Louis Blues beat Edmonton 3-1 Thursday night, spoiling Oilers rookie Connor McDavid's NHL debut. Vladimir Tarasenko had the tying goal for the Blues near the midpoint of the second period, and Troy Brouwer added an empty-netter with 18 seconds remaining in the third. Brian Elliott finished with 23 saves. Ryan Nugent-Hopkins scored in the first period for Edmonton and Cam Talbot had 28 saves. McDavid, the No. 1 overall pick in this year's draft, took 22 shifts, played 18:07 and was on the ice for Brouwer's goal. He had two shots on goal, and struggled on faceoffs — winning only three of 13. VIDEOS Check out all the Trib TopJobs Fabbri, a 19-year-old forward — and McDavid's childhood friend — was also playing in his first NHL game. The Blues' first-round pick in 2014 was one of three rookies in the St. Louis lineup, joining Colton Parayko and Joel Edmundson. Nugent-Hopkins gave the Oilers a 1-0 lead late in the first period with a fluke power-play goal. He lost a face-off but when Blues defenseman Alex Pietrangelo tried to clear the puck it bounced off Alexander Steen and past Brian Elliott.
